text: Transcriptional and post - transcriptional regulation of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression during monocytic differentiation of human myeloid leukemic cells .

AP-1 , the polypeptide product of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , recognizes and binds to specific DNA sequences and stimulates transcription of genes responsive to certain growth factors and phorbol esters such as 12-O-tetradecanoylphorbol-13-acetate ( TPA ) .

text: We studied the effects of TPA on the regulation of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene expression in HL-60 cells during monocytic differentiation .

text: Low levels of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> transcripts were detectable in untreated HL-60 leukemic cells , increased significantly by 6 h , and reached near maximal levels by 24 h of exposure to 32 nM TPA .

text: Similar kinetics of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> induction by TPA were observed in human U-937 and THP-1 monocytic leukemia cells .
Similar findings were obtained with bryostatin 1 ( 10 nM ) , another activator of protein kinase C and inducer of monocytic differentiation .

Furthermore , 1 , 25-dihydroxyvitamin D3 ( 0.5 microM ) , a structurally distinct agent which also induces HL-60 monocytic differentiation , increased <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> expression .

text: The half-life of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA as determined by treating HL-60 cells with TPA and actinomycin D was 30 min .
In contrast , the half-life of <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA in TPA - treated HL-60 cells exposed to cycloheximide and actinomycin D was greater than 2 h .

These findings suggested that the increase in <extra_id_0> c-jun <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> RNA observed during TPA - induced monocytic differentiation is mediated by both transcriptional and post - transcriptional mechanisms .
